intro: Disperis flava, commonly known as the yellow disperis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and prefers well-drained soils. It has linear, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Disperis flava is often found in open areas and is adapted to seasonal rainfall patterns.
